recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 17.3 ounce package Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets (1 sheet), thawed
1: 1   egg
2: 1  tablespoon  water
3: 4  ounces  Gorgonzola cheese, crumbled
4: 1  3  ounce package cream cheese, softened
5: 1/3 cup  walnuts, toasted and chopped
6: 2  tablespoons  minced sun-dried tomatoes
7: 1  tablespoon  chopped fresh parsley
8: Cracked black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 375 degrees F.  Beat the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork or whisk.
1: Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.  Roll the pastry sheet into a 12-inch square.  Cut into 24 (3x2-inch) rectangles.  Place the pastry rectangles onto a baking sheet.  Brush with the egg mixture.
2: Bake for 10 minutes or until the pastries are golden brown.  Remove the pastries from the baking sheet and let cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes.  Split the pastries into 2 layers, making 48 in all.
3: Stir the Gorgonzola cheese, cream cheese, walnuts, tomatoes and parsley in a medium bowl with a fork.  Season with the black pepper.  Spread 1 tablespoon cheese mixture onto 24 bottom pastry layers and top with the top pastry layers.
4: Bake for 5 minutes or until the filling is hot.
recipe_description: Imagine the compliments you'll get when you serve these light and flaky puff pastry squares oozing with melted cheese, sun-dried tomatoes and walnuts. They're absolutely delicious.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6  medium potatoes, such as russet (2 pounds)
1: Cooking oil, shortening, butter, or margarine
2: 1/4 cup  butter or margarine, melted
3: 1/4 teaspoon  seasoned salt
4: Ground red pepper
5: 4  ounces  co-jack cheese, cheddar cheese, or Monterey Jack cheese with peppers, shredded (1 cup)
6: Toppers, such as dairy sour cream, salsa, guacamole, chopped tomato, chopped sweet pepper, sliced green onion, sliced pitted ripe olives, or snipped fresh cilantro
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 425 degree F. Thoroughly scrub potatoes; pat dry. Rub with cooking oil, shortening, butter, or margarine; prick potatoes with a fork. Bake for 40 to 60 minutes or till tender. (Or, microwave on high for 15 to 20 minutes or till tender.) Cut potatoes lengthwise into quarters. Scoop out the pulp, leaving 1/4-inch-thick shells. Reserve the pulp for mashed potatoes or another use.
1: Brush both sides of the potato pieces with the 1/4 cup butter or margarine. Sprinkle the insides with seasoned salt and ground red pepper. Place potato pieces, skin sides up, on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat for 3 minutes.
2: Turn potato pieces skin sides down. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Broil 2 minutes more. Arrange the potato pieces on a heated serving platter. Serve with desired toppers. Makes 24 servings.
recipe_description: Set out the toppers for the potato skins and let guests create their own appetizers.
